intro: Adenostoma fasciculatum var. densifolium, commonly known as the thickleaf coyotebrush, is a shrub native to the western United States. It is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant has aromatic leaves that release a strong scent when crushed, a trait common among members of the Asteraceae family. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in chaparral and coastal sage scrub habitats. Its adaptability to harsh conditions makes it an important component of its native ecosystem.
